top_comment.text:
TL;DR version: I haven't touched my 360 since I first played GTA5; it made 
me fall out of love with gaming just the same way Mass Effect 3 did.

I couldn't stand the first hour of gameplay, honestly. I mean, GTA IV was 
clunky, but at least the characters had some respectable motivation. The 
awful, self-pitying asshat that is Jimmy... he was just so unpleasant that 
his little tirade after the freeway yacht chase was enough to put me off 
the game for good. I tried booting up my 360 the next day, but I felt this 
deep apprehension hit me, like forcing myself to go out to a party full of 
people I knew I couldn't stand.

Rockstar crafted an ugly, soulless world full of ugly, soulless people, and 
the worst part is this: Rockstar takes their "satire" seriously, and acts 
like they're holding up a mirror to America and saying "this is you." I 
don't have to listen to that, I don't want to, and I won't.﻿
top_comment.author: Josh Rose

comments.text:
Hmmm.. Interesting. 


I'm really not sure what's worse here; the fact that you got so mad about 
the perceived message of GTA that you've actually stopped playing 
videogames altogether, or that you assume that I feel bad because you did 
that to yourself.


 I mean, I could understand if you just didn't like it. That's one thing. 
The plot just plain sucks. Okay, fine. If it's that important that to you, 
then just stop playing it. Sell it on Ebay, get some money, and buy another 
game that you might actually enjoy.

But this? You interpreted the game's plot in a way that you didn't like, 
and basically covered your ears, saying "lalalalalalALALALALA I DON'T WANT 
TO HEAR THIS! LALALALALA-FUCKING-LA!".

And now, you hate games.

That..

That's just.. stupid.

comments.author: Josh Rose

comments.text:
+Josh Rose Josh Rose punched the wall until his knuckles were bleeding, 
having flipped a table not mere seconds before after reading the flashing 
words on his screen.

"How could this be?" he asked himself while his retinas contracted and 
driplets of foam rolled of the corner of his mouth. "How can he not bow to 
my absolutely perfect soliloquy about the evils of modern gaming! I even 
used big word! Big I say!" 

He paced around the basement, stepping over the remnants of his smartphone. 
It's fate sealed after it was used to look up the definition of "strawman" 
in the dictionary. 

But then, a flash of brilliance overcame him and like an drunken mule he 
raced to his still functional computer. 

"I know!" He cried onto heavens, hands shaking of emotion, "I'll pretend to 
be unfazed...and and...it will have to be true! because nothing anyone on 
the internet can never be false!"

His maniacal laughter frightened  even then lize-sized doll of Haruhi, 
while her cold dead eyes revealed horrors beyond the understanding of 
mortal men. 

Josh's  cackled with glee as he regaled the second part of his plan 
seemingly to no one, "In case he retorts....I'll say it was my plan all 
along to lead him on...because NO ONE on the whole wide world has thought 
of it before...because no one has my WIT!.....and to top it all" he said 
licking his lips, "I'll say...he's.....retarded" he pronounced looking 
around as if invisible eyes were leering, judging him....flashbacks to high 
school flooding his memory.

That word....that word....
comments.author: andrey22

comments.text:
+andrey22 What evidence do you have that I dislike things solely because 
they're popular? All you could possibly know right now is that I dislike 
something that you like.

How does my statement about worldly decadence contradict with me calling 
you out on referencing a logically fallacy (and wrongly, at that)?

Any story with any kind of statement, intentional or not (though in this 
case, VERY intentional) can change anybody's mind. This story spreads a 
Carlin-esque hatred of life and it is disgusting.

I must say, I'm impressed how your "rebuttal" lacks any coherence or grasp 
on reality whatsoever. I want to hear more. I never enjoy flamewars, but 
this special brand of idiocy actually intrigues me.

Please, reply. I want to hear you speak. Mental retardation fascinates me.
comments.author: Josh Rose

comments.text:
+Josh Rose Sigh...son, first of all, being a contrarian does not constitute 
a personality. You don't like popular things by default and you romantizise 
reasons why you don't like em but the core remains on you not liking 
popular stuffs. That's a knee-jer reaction, sure, but hey, you've got to 
practice what you preach, right?
Your "TL;DR" intro contradicts point number 2, so that makes your essay a 
C+ at best.
And as a closing statement, yes they are. If they weren't you would not be 
trying to win an internet slap fight by pretending that video games have 
more impact than they do. If we follow your train of thought, "Child's 
Play" charity would actually be a treatment for cancer.
comments.author: andrey22

comments.text:
+andrey22 TL;DR version: You, the things you value, and people like you are *the 
reason the world sucks now*.
1) I'm reacting because pompous, media-over-saturated people like you are 
the majority. That fact sickens me and I want to change that.
2) It is impossible for you to "be" a straw man, by the way, so don't throw 
around words that you don't know.
3) My feelings are not hurt. I'm just acknowledging that stories, not just 
"violent vidya games" or "depraved movies" or "smutty books," but actual 
*stories* like these and the cultural worship and languishing thereon act 
as the moral, mental, and philosophical atrophy of an entire generation.
comments.author: Josh Rose

comments.text:
+Josh Rose Then you're being awfuly defensive about a knee-jerk reaction. 
If it were as you say, then it would have slided off your back but instead 
you created a ficticious scenario in your head where I'm a strawman and 
your philosophy 101 gives you a standing ovation. Was this the same 
mentality that urged you to write an ode to your hurt feelings over a 
videogame or was it because people found your feelings hilarious instead of 
tearfully clapping at your tirade of being emotionally scarred by the 
latest toy to hit the shelves? If it's the latter, well, I think you came 
to the wrong site. Tumblr's just around the corner.
comments.author: andrey22

comments.text:

comments.author: Josh Rose

comments.author: holythirteenx1

comments.text:
+Jose Gonzalez  to be fair your right it's not always like i previously 
stated. but a lot of times when it comes to big budget names (example mass 
effect 3 or COD) reviewers are pretty much told how to frame the review and 
if the reviewer refuses or doesn't "play ball" then they are replaced by 
someone who will. (look up the name Jeff Gerstmann sometime.)

And from what i hear from other people from in the industry (not just on 
the media side but also on the dev/publisher side as well) these backroom 
deals are as one guy put it "just part of the business that not many talk 
about"

the reason i think it's true (at least to some extent) is because from a 
business standpoint it makes sense. the fastest way to get people to buy 
your product is word of mouth and if you control what that mouth says then 
you can get large sales. (this also explanes the media embargo put on games 
for X amount of time) sure people will hear the truth from let's players 
and youtube reviewers and independents however by that time the game will 
have sold enough to withstand even the harshest critics.

as much as i love the video game industry. i am not naive enough to 
recognize that a multi billion dollar market can and does have a 
underbelly. after all what's considered a hobby to me is a job to someone 
else. because someone has to make and sell this entertainment for me to buy 
and enjoy.
comments.author: Dragonking1984

comments.text:
+Dragonking1984 To rebut your last point, I'm small fish compared to IGN 
and when I was working for an indie site, I got a review copy of LEGO The 
Hobbit.

I was more told that it involves a long process of communication between 
you and the PR firm that handles that type of stuff. While on the outside, 
it can look like IGN's giving BJs to devs and pubs, it's not always the 
case.
comments.author: Jose Gonzalez

comments.text:
+Josh Rose the only "reviewers" who get early copies of the game for their 
reviews are the E whores working at places like IGN who will give most 
games a 9/10 blowjob in exchange for a fuckton of ad revenue and perks.

and in return the devs/publishers give them the "job" because they know 
that these same reviewers are going focus on the hype and not give a honest 
fair review. which generates pre orders and early sales of the game.

TLDR: Razorfist and people like him will NEVER get early review copies of 
games because they tell the truth about how good (or assfuckingly bad) a 
game is. and the truth doesn't generate money via sales.
comments.author: Dragonking1984

comments.text:
+Josh Rose Probably because they've done enough dick sucking and ass 
kissing that warrants said copy. The only review copy for a game I got was 
because I worked with the PR company of said developer, not shovel a 
bulldozer-sized cash flow to a publisher or developer.
comments.author: Jose Gonzalez

top_comment.text:
Thank you! Finally someone who isn't jammed so far up Rockstar's ass that I 
can agree with. I loved GTA 5, but it's like you said, I'm afraid they're 
getting into too comfortable of a position with their storylines. I REALLY 
hope the GTA series doesn't go the way of the first-person C.O.D fish and 
get worse with each iteration.﻿
top_comment.author: Wiley Wolfe

comments.text:
+MrShawno1231 Don't get me wrong, I love GTA, especially the gameplay. I 
just don't want rockstar to rest on their laurels and churn out GTA 
iterations just for the hype the name creates alone, we've seen it happen 
before and each time a dev did that the games got progressively worse/more 
disappointing. As for the story, yes GTA isn't all about the plot line, but 
with open world games it's often beneficial to have some context given to 
what you're doing. It's one of the reasons why Rockstar's Red Dead 
Redemption was so successful.
comments.author: Wiley Wolfe

comments.text:
Speaking of Rap/Hip-Hop, how about West Coast Classics.

Two NWA songs, an Ice Cube song, and King Tee featuring Ice Cube and Breeze.
Two Dr. Dre songs, one featuring Snoop Dogg, the other featuring Snoop 
Dogg, Kurupt and Nate Dogg. Snoop Dogg has a song of his own. Kurupt has 
one on his own, one as Tha Dogg Pound (which features Snoop Dogg), and Mack 
10 featuring Tha Dogg Pound.
Then there's a Compton's Most Wanted song, and a solo song by Mc Eiht.

Collaborations are huge in Rap, sure, but even when limited to the 90s west 
coast scene, there's enough to avoid so many overlaps.
comments.author: Korgull6669

captions.text:
In the developmental pitri dish that was Grand
Theft Auto 4, there was perhaps no more potent

contagion than the game's tendency to take
itself... WAY too fucking seriously. With

extremely worthy contenders to its sandbox
crime drama crown materializing in the form

of Sleeping Dogs and the last two exceptional
entries in the Saints Row franchise, frankly...

that was high ground Rockstar could no longer
justify its morbid impulse to cling to. While

GTA5 still features more than a handful of
needlessly sappy, quasi-pretentious interludes,

I'm happy to report that this game also sees
the rebirth of BATSHIT.

Skydiving on an ATV, piloting government jets,
getting higher than Peter Molyneux's forehead

and mowing down ceaseless waves of hallucinatory
homicidal clowns... Grand Theft Auto... is

BACK, motherfucker! And I, for one, missed
the shit out of you, GTA! Don't be a stranger!

Though the most 'significant' change... is
'significant' only at first glance.

My first thought upon hearing of the addition
of three individual player characters you're

usually able to switch between on-the-fly
was to suspect that it would present lucrative

opportunities for non-euclidian narrative
experimentation. Hell, with 3 separate characters,

each with their own unique story, occasionally
intersecting with those of their counterparts...

well shit... how could you not weave a rich,
billowing tapestry of player choice and customizable

narrative?
I'll tell you how. You could be fucking Rockstar.

The Grand Vizier of 'playing it safe'.
"I want you to know I practice safe sex."

"So do I."
The studio that has slovenly rehashed the

same haggard, cliché-bespeckled 'Dark Side
of the American Dream' parable for five successive

entries and half a dozen spin-offs. Linearity
is no longer a lamentable byproduct of GTA's

open-world sandbox structure... it is officially
a calculated, and let's come right the fuck

out with it, INEXCUSABLY FUCKING LAZY design
choice! Want to progress the story? Switch

to the character whose icon is flashing to
tackle said mission and progress the story

in 'connect-the-dots' fucking fashion.
A gilded cage... is still a fucking cage,

Rockstar.
As for the three characters, I can summarize

them in fairly short order:
Trevor is what happens when Rockstar's head

writer watches too much Breaking Bad.
"Fuck... YOU! AND your eyebrows!"

Franklin is what happens when they watch too
much 'The Wire'.

"Sheeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit."
And Michael is what happens when they remember

they're making a Grand Theft Auto game. And
apparently, Rockstar are huuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuge

Breaking Bad fans, because unless you're rockin
Trevor, it is exceptionally likely that the

two most frequently recurring items on your
itinerary will be 'nothing' and 'like it'.

"I want a hot dog, I want a milkshake--"
"YOU'LL GET NOTHING AND LIKE IT!"

Particularly poor, neglected-ass Franklin,
who might have had potential to be my favorite

character, if Rockstar had seen fit to give
him anything at all to fuckin' do! We get

it! Trevor's a 'loose cannon'! A 'free spirit'!
'He plays by his own rules!' But Rockstar,

it is of paramount importance that - as you
feverishly fellate this character until he

leaves a glans shaped impression on your tonsils
- you occasionally come up for goddamn air!

Sure, Trevor's a badass! But I can dress Michael
up to look exactly like Michael Douglas in

Black Rain, so give me something to fuckin'
do with him!

"Fuck you very much."
But all of these issues... minor as they admittedly

are... are fucking secondary... to the 900-pound
simian pinching turds on the dining room table.

Who... in seven adjacent galaxies... chose
the last two miserable fucking GTA soundtracks?!

"AAAAGGGHHHHHH! THIS MUSIC'S ALL WRONG!"
['Foreigner - Cold as Ice' plays]

"THAT'S what I'm lookin' for!"
It's not just me. When the track list was

leaked a month ahead of the game, I can count
the positive comments on one amputated hand.

This shit isn't just subpar for GTA... it's
subpar for Saints fuckin' Row! SAINTS ROW,

people! The series that thinks twelve tracks
of DevilDriver and As I Lay Dying constitutes

a Metal radio station! I mean, at least they
made a shitty, outdated attempt at a metal

station. You've fashioned a fictitious representation
of Los Angeles - the birthplace of Hair Metal,

and a city that (without even counting a half-dozen
pirate stations) has at least one major Metal

station, and no less than three Rock stations
that predominately play Classic Metal! But

does Los Santos have one? FUCK no! But at
least the game has a FUNK station! Asshole,

not only have I never heard a Funk station...
I've never heard of a Funk Station! I ask

again, who picked this fucking soundtrack,
and what is their obsession with Phil Collins,

Stevie Nicks and Queen?! And this malaise
isn't reserved for Rock, either. The Pop songs

are banal, even by Pop standards! 5 games
and still you've used just one Peter Gabriel

song?! And it was only in DLC?? Where's Billy
fucking Ocean? Where's Dale Bozzio? Where's

a Michael Jackson song that isn't featured
on 'Bad' or 'Thriller'? After three straight

soundtracks that set trends, literally defining
the musical taste of an entire generation

of gamers, watching radio stations in subsequent
iterations gradually disintegrate into the

same, vapid shit we've heard played over car
commercials for the past 15 fuckin' years

is a miserable disgrace. You aren't resting
on your laurels. You're locked down in your

kraftmatic with a big gulp, a fistful of cheez-its
and Maury Povich re-runs! And, with all of

two talk radio stations at your disposal as
an alternative to the shitty tunes, it further

has the lamentable gameplay-related side-effect
of turning the mere act of driving into a

full-on fuckin' chore. Tangerine Dream's original
score for the game may well be the best in

the entire series... so get off your ass,
doff the fuckin' sweatpants, and give this

superb game the soundtrack it fucking deserves!
But I'm equally emphatic in my assertion that,

where GTA5 is concerned, there is far more
to be impressed with than to be bothered by.

The cars no longer being constructed of tissue
paper would be the top item on my list. Nothing

was quite so frustrating in GTA4 as finally
gaming the vehicle spawn system into handing

you a bitchin' sports car only to unwittingly
tear the entire fucking fender off in a high-speed

collision with a moth. Vehicular physics are
still janky because Euphoria still fucking

sucks, but being able to customize your ride
to your heart's content more than offsets

this potential irritant. Literally every aspect
of play, from motorcycle handling to mini-games

to character customization to sheer mission
variety has been shorn of all fat and pulled

tighter than Bruce Jenner's cheeks.
Everything, that is, exceeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeept

for helicopter flight! Pop quiz, guys and
gals and gender-nonspecific minorities: However

do you compound the universe-rending awfulness
that is helicopter flight in the first four

Grand Theft Auto titles?
'Build a bridge out of her!'

[Alex Trebek mumbling incoherently]
What is 'Devoting an entire character to the

principle of flying the goofy, off-balance
shit-heaps?' And then repeatedly requiring

the player to perform the aviation equivalent
of threading a needle with a mosquito's cock.

How in fuck is Saints Row better than you
at this-- fuck, how is Saints Row better than

you at anything under the yellow sun?!
"Step your game up!'

For all the upgrades, RPG stat systems and
impressively-fleshed-out mini-games, it's

impossible to escape the feeling that Grand
Theft Auto V's actual story is locked into

a bit of a holding pattern. We get it. Trying
to get rich in America can occasionally suck.

Tell another story, assface. Ever read the
headlines out of Tijuana? Every day in Mexico

is Grand Theft Auto fucking 6! Maybe flip
the roles for once and let the player be a

rogue cop! It would be one step closer to
that open-world sandbox COBRA game I've been

wanting to play ever since I drew my first
fucking breath. Set it in 1985. Turn it into

a parody of action films for all I care!.
Just change it the fuck up once a decade or

so, because while your gameplay pioneers new
heights, your story is beginning to quote

itself!
Quoth the Razör: God - fuckin' - SPEED!

"What we need to indentify is a degree of
authenticity and compassion in the way we

deal with this problem. Otherwise, you just
seem like you don't know what you're talking

about."
"But CRIME--"

"We've talked about that-- you can tell what
Party they're in from their questions, innit?"
"What about the VICTIMS of the crime?!"
"THIS IS A JOKE WITH NO PUNCHLINE!!"

title: Grand Theft Auto V - The Rageaholic
